Detailed Description

FfsHandler provides an object-oriented interface to the FFS. Please also refer to the class FlsFile, which provides an easy-to-use interface for using the FFS.

The following code fragment shows some examples of the FfsHandler interface. If working on host, you can easily observe the content of the file with a simple text-editor.

    FfsHandle fhandle;
    const CHAR *fname = "A";
    const INT fsize = 128;
    const INT offset = 0;
    const CHAR src[] = "This text is written into the file.";
    const CHAR mod_src[] = "This text overwrites some data in the file.";

    // Check if the file already exists.
    if (!FfsHandler::FileExist(fname)) {
        // Create the file if not already created.
        if (FfsHandler::Create(fname, &fhandle, FfsFileTypeTxt, fsize) == FfsErrorSuccess) {
            // Write something into the file starting at offset.
            if (FfsHandler::Write(fname, fhandle, src, offset, sizeof(src)) == FfsErrorSuccess) {
                // Close the file again.
                FfsHandler::Close(fname, fhandle);
            } else {
                // Deal with the error.
                return FALSE;
            }
        } else {
            // Deal with the error.
            return FALSE;
        }
    } else {
        // Open the file in modify mode if it already exists.
        if (FfsHandler::Open(fname, &fhandle, FfsOpenModeModify) == FfsErrorSuccess) {
            // Modify a part of the file.
            if (FfsHandler::Modify(fname, fhandle, mod_src, offset, sizeof(mod_src)) == FfsErrorSuccess) {
                // Close the file again.
                FfsHandler::Close(fname, fhandle);
            } else {
                // Deal with the error.
                return FALSE;
            }
        } else {
            // Deal with the error.
            return FALSE;
        }
    }
    return TRUE;

NOTE: Please do not instantiate this class.

FfsError FfsHandler::Append (  const CHAR *  filename,
FfsHandle  h,
const void FFS_HUGE *  src,
UINT32  no_bytes,
FfsUserType  user_id = FfsUserTypeMmi
)  [static]
 

Adds the data from the specified src at the end of the file with the specified filename. Only possible if the file exists and is open in FfsOpenModeAppend.

FfsError FfsHandler::Copy (  const CHAR *  filename,
const CHAR *  dst_filename,
FfsUserType  user_id = FfsUserTypeMmi
)  [static]
 

Copies an existing file with the specified filename to new file with dst_filename. Only possible if the source file exists and is closed. The destination file will be created automatically, afterwards the content of the source file will be written in the destination file.

FfsError FfsHandler::Copy (  FfsFileId  id,
FfsFileId  dst_id,
FfsUserType  user_id = FfsUserTypeMmi
)  [static]
 

Copies an existing file with the specified id to a new file with dst_id. Only possible if the source file exists and is closed. The destination file will be created automatically, afterwards the content of the source file will be written in the destination file.

FfsUserType  user_id = FfsUserTypeMmi
)  [static]
 

Creates a new file with the specified filename and size. The file is opened in write-mode afterwards. Stores the file handle at the location specified by hp.

)  [static]

FfsFileId *  id,
FfsFileType  type
)  [static]

UINT16 FfsHandler::GetNofFiles (   )  [static]
 

Returns the number of the stored files in the FFS.

Returns the number of the stored files in the FFS with the specified type.

UINT32 FfsHandler::GetReservedSpace (   )  [static]
 

Returns the reserved space of the global memory pool.

UINT32 FfsHandler::GetReservedSpace (  FfsFileType  type  )  [static]
 

Returns the reserved space of the regarding memory pool. This method should be called to determine if the usage of GetUsedSpaceByType() is possible. These values are defined at compile-time, in the ffs_memory_pool_reservations-table, which is located in the file ffs_def.h, and therefore never change.

UINT32 FfsHandler::GetTotalSpace (   )  [static]
 

Returns the maximum available bytes in the FFS, i.e.: The amount of free bytes in an empty FFS. This value is defined at compile-time, and therefore never changes.

UINT32 FfsHandler::GetUsedSpace (   )  [static]
 

Returns the total number of bytes used in the FFS. Please be aware, that the amount is always larger than the sum of all filesizes, since there is some overhead included due to the nature of the FFS.

UINT32 FfsHandler::GetUsedSpaceByType (  FfsFileType  type  )  [static]
 

Returns the total number of bytes used in the regarding memory pool. If no reservation (i.e.: 0 bytes) is defined in the ffs_memory_pool_reservations-table, which is located in the file ffs_def.h, the return value is also 0. Therefore, it is necessary to check the reserved space for the memory pool via the GetReservedSpace() method to make sure the usage of this method makes sense. Please be aware, that the amount is always larger than the sum of all filesizes in the regarding memory pool, since there is some overhead included due to the nature of the FFS.

UINT32 FfsHandler::GetUsedSpaceInGlobalPool (   )  [static]
 

Returns the used space in the global pool.

BOOLEAN FfsHandler::IsDirectory (  const CHAR *  pathname,
FfsUserType  user_id = FfsUserTypeMmi
)  [static]
 

Judge if a path name is a directory.

Parameters:
pathname The directory name to be judged.
Returns:
TRUE if the pathname is a directory. FALSE if the pathname is not a directory.
